definitions.definition: the body of a dead animal, especially a large one that is soon to be cut up as meat or eaten by wild animals:
examples: Vultures flew around in the sky waiting to pick at the rotting carcass of the deer.

definitions.definition: the frame of an old or broken object, car, ship, etc.:
examples: Carcasses of burned-out vehicles lined the roads near the scene of the worst fighting.
